intro: Calothamnus planifolius, commonly known as the flat-leaved bottlebrush, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, cylindrical flower spikes that are often red or pink in color. The plant has narrow, linear leaves that are arranged oppositely along the stems. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is found in coastal regions of southern Australia. Calothamnus planifolius is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant flowers and unique appearance.
